scenes.plot_segment: A voice recaps the challenges of surgical residency, warning that many will not make it through. Meredith and Derek awkwardly discuss their previous night together, agreeing to keep it secret as he is her superior. Dr. Bailey assigns the interns their duties and makes it clear that no one will operate until she is satisfied. Meredith is approached by Izzie and George about living together, but she is reluctant to have roommates.

Meredith narrates about boundaries and lines in the hospital and personal life. She interviews potential roommates, ultimately rejecting Izzie and George. The interns begin their shifts, each assigned specific tasks by Dr. Bailey. The interns express their desire to perform surgeries, but Bailey reminds them their job is to make her happy, not to cut.

Meredith and Cristina discuss Seattle's ferryboats. Derek tries to flirt with Meredith, but she insists on drawing a line between them. They banter about their relationship and boundaries in the elevator. Meredith insists she will not date or sleep with Derek again because he is her boss.

A trauma case arrives: a 25-year-old female, Allison, is brought in with severe injuries after being attacked. The team discovers she fought back against her attacker. In surgery, Meredith realizes that Allison bit off her attacker's penis, which she now must keep in her custody for the police.

The doctors discuss Allison's prognosis. Derek is invited for a drink by another doctor, who learns he was recruited by the chief. Cristina is frustrated with her assignments, and Alex Karev is introduced as her new shadow. Cristina and Alex immediately clash.

George leads a code team on a patient in asystole. Izzie attempts to suture a patient, Mrs. Lu, but faces a language barrier. Cristina is unable to help translate, revealing she is Korean, not Chinese. Meredith is questioned about her mother's career by another doctor.

Meredith is told she must keep custody of the severed penis until the police arrive. She is unsure what to do with it. The interns joke about Meredith's predicament. Izzie is emotionally affected by Allison's case, relating to her through their shared choice of shoes. Cristina suggests they engage in a secret activity to cope with stress.

Izzie and Cristina compete to deliver lab results quickly, agreeing not to get emotionally involved with patients. They inform patients of their benign diagnoses. George loses a patient during a code.

The doctors discuss the search for Allison's attacker, believing the severed penis will help identify him. Meredith learns Allison has no family in Seattle. Meredith leaves to address another concern, while George stays with Allison.

Meredith asks Dr. Burke to check on a baby she suspects has a heart murmur. Burke refuses without a consult from pediatrics, citing hospital rules. Izzie is recognized by a patient from a magazine photo. She tries to treat Mrs. Lu but cannot communicate.

Meredith and Cristina talk in a supply room. Meredith confesses she kissed Derek in the elevator. They discuss the stress of the day and Allison's shoes. Cristina comments that it's strange Meredith cares so much.

Security is called as a man with a severe groin injury is brought in. The doctors realize he is Allison's attacker. Meredith is instructed to call the chief. The surgical team discusses why the severed penis cannot be reattached and the consequences for the attacker.

Dr. Burke confronts the chief about bringing Derek to the hospital and questions his own standing as a candidate for chief of surgery. The chief criticizes Burke for not going above and beyond in his work and tells him to earn the position.

Izzie apologizes to Mrs. Lu for not being able to help her due to the language barrier. Mrs. Lu leaves the hospital. Izzie later finds her outside and discovers Mrs. Lu is undocumented and afraid of being reported. Izzie treats her wound outside the hospital and arranges a secret follow-up.

Burke reviews the baby's test results and confirms Meredith was right about the heart defect. He thanks her but warns her not to go behind other doctors' backs again. Burke schedules surgery for the baby.

The interns gather and express their frustrations about feeling unprepared and disconnected from the real work of surgery. Meredith, Izzie, George, Cristina, and Alex share their doubts and exhaustion.
Izzie finishes treating Mrs. Lu outside and gives her instructions for a secret follow-up. Mrs. Lu thanks her. Izzie returns to the hospital.

Cristina asks Burke if she is too confident. Burke allows her to speak freely for 30 seconds. Cristina tells him he is arrogant and self-centered. George confides in Cristina that he lost five patients on the code team and feels like the angel of death. Cristina reassures him that most code patients cannot be revived.
Meredith and George discuss the baby's upcoming heart surgery. Meredith admits she is terrified as an intern. George agrees, and they bond over their shared anxiety.
George sits with Allison, who remains unconscious. Meredith joins him, and they talk about family and loneliness. Meredith reflects on her mother, and George shares about his sisters.

Meredith and Derek discuss their relationship. Derek jokes about their kissing and asks if it will happen again. Meredith changes the subject, reflecting on the innocence of newborns and the violence Allison suffered.
Allison's condition worsens, and she is rushed to surgery for a craniotomy. Derek explains to Meredith that Allison's prognosis is uncertain and depends on whether she wakes up.

Burke declines Cristina's invitation for a drink. Burke and Derek discuss their rivalry for chief of surgery. Burke tells Derek that Richard promised the position to both of them, but Derek is not the enemy, just the competition.
Meredith hands over the severed penis to the police, completing the chain-of-custody paperwork. She jokes with another doctor about the awkwardness of the situation.
Burke begins the baby's heart surgery and invites Meredith to scrub in and assist. Meredith is excited for the opportunity.
The doctors inform Allison's attacker that his penis cannot be reattached and he will have lasting consequences. Another patient is told her tumor is benign and she can go home.
Meredith narrates about boundaries and decisions. She tells George and Izzie they can move into her house. They celebrate, and Meredith jokes about blaming babies for her decision.

Meredith continues her narration about crossing lines. She and Derek share a moment about ferryboats. Meredith chooses to take the stairs instead of the elevator with Derek, joking about her lack of self-control.
Meredith concludes that taking risks can lead to spectacular outcomes. The episode ends with her reflection on boundaries and the rewards of crossing them.
